hardwareAbstraction
Class LinePoller

java.lang.Object
  hardwareAbstraction.LinePoller

public class LinePoller
extends java.lang.Object

Detects grid lines with two rear floor facing color sensors other threads should call enteringLine to know when a new line has been detected

Uses a mean and difference filter to detect the lines. Once enteringLine has been called, its control variable will be reset and it will no longer return true until a new line has been crossed

Field Detail

UPDATE_PERIOD

private final int UPDATE_PERIOD
Period to update the sensors and run the detection algorithm. default 15 ms

See Also:
Constant Field Values

THRESHOLD

private final int THRESHOLD
Threshold for the detection algorithm. Most lines are well above 70, and maximum noise is less than 40

See Also:
Constant Field Values

sensorOnLine

private boolean[] sensorOnLine
boolean variable for storing whether a sensor is on a line or not

sensorEnteringLine

private boolean[] sensorEnteringLine
boolean variable for keeping track of whether a sensor has entered a new line. This is used by enteringLine

sensor

private ColorSensor[] sensor
Array of line Color sensors

timer

private Timer timer
Timer for timer listener

readings

public int[][] readings
Array of readings. stores 4 readings for each sensor

left

private int left
identifier for the left sensor

right

private int right
identifier for the right sensor

Constructor Detail

LinePoller

public LinePoller()
Initializes the two color sensors as specified in Settings as well it initializes the arrays required.

it sets the floodlight to Red for each sensor, and starts the timer

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts line polling And populates array with readings

timedOut

public void timedOut()
Takes new getRawLightValue() reading and stores it in the readings array by calling addReading()

then calls detectLine() for each sensor

addReading

private void addReading(int sensor,
                        int reading)
Adds a new reading to the readings array for the passed sensor. it will be put in the 0th index.

Parameters:
sensor - id of the sensor the reading was from
reading - value of reading

detectLine

private void detectLine(int sensor)
Uses mean and difference filtering to detect a line.

if a new line is detected (using THRESHOLD), it will set sensorOnLine[sensor] to true and sensorEnteringLine[sensor] to true

if the end of a line was detected it will reset sensorOnLine[sensor] and sensorEnteringLine[sensor] to false.

Parameters:
sensor -

enteringLine

public boolean enteringLine(int sensor)
Returns true if the sensor has detected a new black line, is still on the line and the method has not yet been called since the line's detction. Once called and if sensorEnteringLine[sensor] is true, it will reset sensorEnteringLine[sensor].

Parameters:
sensor - | left = 0 & right = 1
Returns:

setFloodlight

public void setFloodlight(int sensor,
                          int color)
Sets the floodlight color of the color sensor. It will make sure the floodlight is set by ensuring getRawLightValue does not return -1. The method will not return until the sensor outputs valid data (i.e. not -1)

Parameters:
sensor -
color -

nap

public void nap(int time)
Helper method to avoid large try/catch blocks. Sleeps the current thread.

Parameters:
time - int value which represents the sleep time
